intro: Henslowia laevis, commonly known as the smooth henslowia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Henslowia laevis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
